snippet: Parents in Chicago have filed two federal lawsuits opposing proposed school closings. In March, the Chicago Public Schools identified 53 schools that it planned to close.
abstract: Parents in Chicago file two federal lawsuits opposing proposed closings of 53 public schools; suits allege that closings would violate both Americans With Disabilities Act and Illinois civil rights law.
lead_paragraph: Parents in Chicago have filed two federal lawsuits opposing proposed school closings. In March, the Chicago Public Schools identified 53 schools that it planned to close.

headline.main: Illinois: Lawsuits Filed Over Chicago School Closings
headline.print_headline: Illinois: Lawsuits Filed Over Chicago School Closings
